paper_metadata.title: Digital Economy Development and Multidimensional Relative Poverty: Evidence from China's Broadband Infrastructure Policy

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: We develop a multidimensional relative poverty index encompassing economic, health, education, and living condition aspects utilizing the Alkire-Foster dual cutoff method
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: employ a staggered Difference-in-Differences design for empirical analysis

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: In August 2013, the State Council launched the "Broadband China" (hereafter BC) Strategy and Implementation Plan to develop a new generation of digital infrastructure
evidence_citations.country_citation: Despite the eradication of absolute poverty in China, the world's largest developing country, relative poverty is expected to persist
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: Based on microdata derived from the China Family Panel Studies (2010-2022), this study employs the "Broadband China" pilot policy as a quasi-natural experiment
